audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.head.title: audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.body.p:87-3
audio_emitter_exists: This function returns whether an audio emitter exists (<tt>true</tt>) or not (<tt>false</tt>). Note that if the index you search for has not been initialised previously, this function will cause an error as it is searching for non-existent indices.

audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.head.title: audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:99-9
audio_emitter_exists: The index of the emitter to check the existence of.

audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.head.title: audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.body.p:108-3
audio_emitter_exists:
{ANY_CODE} if audio_emitter_exists(s_emit)
{nbsp_x3}{
{nbsp_x3}audio_play_sound_on(s_emit, snd_Explode, false, 1);
{nbsp_x3}}
else
{nbsp_x3}{
{nbsp_x3}s_emit = audio_emitter_create();
{nbsp_x3}audio_play_sound_on(s_emit, snd_Explode, false, 1);
{nbsp_x3}}

audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.head.title: audio_emitter_exists.htm+html.body.p:114-3
audio_emitter_exists: The above code checks to see if an emitter exists, indexed in the (previously initialised) variable "s_emit". If it does then a sound is played through it, but if it does not, it is created and then the sound is played.
